授業目的: The purpose of this course is for students to understand the history and principles of Canadian economy and its interaction with the economy of Japan.
到達目標:
The students will learn how Canadian economy developed over time, how it compares with other modern economies (including Japan), and how it interacts with the other economies.
The students will be familiarized with the differences and similarities between the North American (Canada) and East Asian (Japan) financial markets and institutions.
The students will be able to discuss the cultural nuances of doing business in Canada compared to Japan.
特記事項: 本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
関連科目: NO previous knowledge of economics, mathematics, finance, or business science is required.
授業の概要・背景: The course will cover topics on Canadian economy, its historical and cultural aspects, interaction and comparison with the economy of Japan. The course does NOT require previous knowledge of economics, mathematics, finance, or business science. The course will primarily involve lecture style format, but participation and discussion among the students is welcome and encouraged.
授業方法: Lecture primarily. However, participation and discussion among the students is welcome and encouraged.
